task_summary: Detect the white carton, align to it, push it a short distance to the right, then retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A UR-style manipulator interacts with several tabletop objects (bottles, cans, a red cup, and a light/white carton-like object). The goal is to push the white carton without grasping it. The robot must first perceive and localize the target, then approach and align its end-effector to ensure a straight push, execute a 10 cm push to the right, and finally retreat to clear the workspace. Timing and tolerances are modest to balance reliability and speed.
preconditions: Workspace is clear of unexpected obstacles along the push path.
White carton is on the table and visible to the camera.
Robot is homed and gripper open.
stepwise_plan: Approach and align to the face intended for pushing (tolerance 0.02).
Execute Push for 0.10 m at 90Â° direction.
success_criteria: White carton translates approximately 10 cm along the intended direction.
No grasping occurs; motion is a surface push.
failure_and_recovery: If detection fails, retry detection up to 3 times.
If alignment error exceeds tolerance, re-approach.
If push stalls due to collision, abort and retreat.
task_long_description.termination: Behavior ends after retreat completes or after repeated detection failure.

frame_3.now_evidence: First clear alignment of end-effector with the white target; contact about to occur.

node_specs.description: Perceive and localize the white carton.
Approach the carton and align the TCP for a straight push.
Push the carton 10 cm to the right.
Back away to clear after pushing.

recovery_strategy: Abort push and retreat if unexpected contact
assumptions: 'White carton' corresponds to the light/white cylindrical carton-like object visible near table center-right.
Push direction_deg=90 interpreted as rightward in the scene frame; actual table frame may differ.

expected_success_criteria: End-effector contacts target and translates it ~0.10 m along planned direction.
